item.title: Is Highguard on PlayStation 5 & Xbox Series X|S? All Platforms, Explained
item.content:encoded:
The year ahead promises to be a big one for gaming, with 2026 stacked full of big releases, and Highguard is among the major names landing this year, though there has been some confusion about the platform availability.

Revealed at The Game Awards, Highguard is set to be released on January 26, though the build-up has gone under the radar for many players due to an eerie radio silence from the developer.

Expect that to change in the final days before release, however, and if you want to know which platforms Highguard is available on, Insider Gaming has the details.

Is Highguard on PlayStation 5?

Yes, Highguard is available on PlayStation 5, as the title from the creators of Apex Legends and Titanfall is releasing the game across all major platforms.

PlayStation 5 is, naturally, among those platforms, and, similarly to other games in the genre, crossplay will allow you to play with friends and other players across various platforms.

Uncertainty over the title being available on PlayStation stems from a very quiet build-up to the game, with pre-ordering and wishlisting for the title not available, apart from the latter on Steam.

Is Highguard on Xbox Series X|S?

Yes, just like PlayStation 5, Highguard will be available on Xbox Series X|S at launch, allowing players on the platform to join the new title at any point.

Similar to the PlayStation confusion, the quiet approach to promotion on Highguard has led to some queries on what platforms exactly the game will be released on, with details scarce following the initial trailer.

However, that trailer, albeit briefly, confirmed Highguard will be available on Xbox Series X|S, so fear not if you’re active on either console, as the game will be available.

Is Highguard on PC?

Highguard will be playable on PC, and, in fact, Steam is the only place in the build-up to the launch where you can wishlist the title.

While store listings have been absent on other platforms, the Steam listing for Highguard has been live since the unveil, and you can add the game to your wishlist so you don’t forget exactly when it drops.

If you play on PC, you won’t be locked out of playing with those on other platforms, as the game will feature full crossplay support.

Do you have high expectations for Highguard? Share your thoughts on the upcoming release in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Highguard, read how the developer didn’t pay for a spot in The Game Awards finale, and find out why some gamers fear the title could be dead on arrival.

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1677: Hints and Answer for January 21, 2026
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1677 for January 21, 2026

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a popular online trend.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There is currently no app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, January 21, 2026

The Wordle answer for game #1677 is a tough puzzle, but not as hard as yesterday. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.8 of 6 guesses. That makes it even tougher than the 6-guess average from January 20.

General Wordle Hints For January 21

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word is often used in math, science, or design contexts.
  • Hint 2: It describes something defined more by shape or structure than by function.
  • Hint 3: You’ll commonly see it paired with units or measurements.
  • Hint 4: The word is more likely to appear in technical writing than in casual conversation.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1677 for January 21, 2026.

Starter Words For January 21, 2026

If you want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • CUBIT
  • MUSIC
  • CUMIN
  • CIVIC

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1677 On January 21, 2026

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: CUBIC

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

What Does Today’s Wordle Answer Mean?

CUBIC is an adjective that means “having three dimensions; solid” or “pertaining to the measurement of volume”.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1676 on January 20, 2026

Answer: SULLY

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1677?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12 am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on January 22 will be Wordle Game #1678.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game challenges players to guess a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

For even more Insider Gaming delivered straight to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

More from Mike Straw

item.title: What is Fortnite Pimlico? New Game Mode, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite continues to get a regular slew of updates and, following on from the major South Park collab introduced earlier this month, a new game mode, dubbed Pimlico, is set to be added.

Regular content drops in Fortnite often include new game modes, ranging from permanent additions, like Fortnite OG and LEGO Fortnite, to temporary modes, including the recently departed Delulu.

Pimlico is the latest mode set to be added to Fortnite, and Insider Gaming has details on everything we know so far.

What is Pimlico in Fortnite?

Pimlico is a new game mode coming to Fortnite that ties in with another Epic Games title, Fall Guys, but the full details are scarce.

A full reveal of the Pimlico game mode is set to be made on January 21, so this article will be updated with official details as soon as possible, but there are some intriguing leaks that have emerged.

Teasers posted on X by Stentric showed Fall Guys characters dressed as birds, with one holding a basketball-like object, with the caption ‘Why Fall when you can Ball?’ Suggesting that the new mode could be a mixture of sports game in a similar style to Fall Guys, which will be playable through Fortnite.

In October, leakers first revealed the Pimlico mode, said to be in collaboration with Warner Bros, which incidentally coincides with the upcoming addition of Warner Bros’ skins in Fortnite, with the likes of Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, and Daffy Duck rumored to be landing in the near future.

When is Pimlico Released in Fortnite?

No release date has been confirmed for the arrival of the Pimlico mode in Fortnite, but it’s widely expected to land on the date of the game’s next update.

Thursday, January 22, is the next patch day for Fortnite, bringing additional content into the game, and the addition of the new mode is a big one after the exit of Delulu this week.

A full reveal of the mode will take place on Wednesday, January 21, unveiling exactly what players can expect, and there’s sure to be a slew of new information.

What do you want to see added to Fortnite this year? Share your ideas in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out rumors of an upcoming Minecraft collab, find out how to get Memberberries to advance through the South Park Mini Pass, and learn about the Stick of Truth.

item.title: Former Nintendo President Joins Hasbro Board of Directors
item.content:encoded:
Former President and CEO of Nintendo of America, Doug Bowser, has joined Hasbro’s board of directors.

For those unaware, it was announced back in September 2025 that Doug Bowser will retire from his position as President of Nintendo of America on December 31, 2025, with Devon Pritchard taking his place in the new year. Now, Bowser will be taking up a new position in one of the biggest toy, games, and IP companies.

Doug Bowser and Carla Vernón Join Hasbro’s Board of Directors

Announced through a new press release, Doug Bowser, the former COO and President of Nintendo of America, and Carla Vernón, the CEO of The Honest Company, have joined Hasbro’s board of directors. Before heading to Hasbro, Doug Bowser was influential in Nintendo’s growth in America, overseeing the launch of Nintendo Switch and the Switch 2 in the Americas. Bowser also helped launch the Nintendo San Francisco Store and expanded the company’s presence in Latin America by re-entering the Brazilian market, among several other contributions.

Carla Vernón, on the other hand, was influential in the strategic and financial transformation of The Honest Company, which led to strengthened operational discipline, improved profitability, and positioned Honest for long-term, sustainable growth.

Here’s what Rich Stoddart, Chair of Hasbro’s Board of Directors, had to say on Doug and Carla joining:

“We are delighted to have Doug and Carla join our seasoned and dynamic Board of Directors. “Doug and Carla bring extensive leadership experience across consumer brands and franchise management. Their expertise and guidance will be invaluable as Hasbro continues to execute its long-term innovation and growth strategy.”

The CEO of Hasbro also shared his views on the recent additions:

“Doug and Carla bring deep expertise in building iconic brands, creating meaningful consumer experiences, and driving innovation and transformation across their respective industries. Their leadership will be invaluable as we continue to execute our Playing To Win strategy and deliver extraordinary play experiences to fans around the world.”

In other news, Nintendo once objected to Sonic outrunning Mario in artwork for the Olympic Games. Additionally, Mario’s voice actor has debunked the “weird online narrative” about Nintendo Directs. What are your thoughts on Former Nintendo President, Doug Bowser, joining Hasbro’s board of directors? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Hitman: World of Assassination receiving a cross-progression update next month. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: All Battlefield 6 Season 1 January 27 Bonus Content—Frostfire Bonus Path & More
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 launched to high praise back in late 2025, and before long, Season 1 kicked off the live-service model for the title. Just as fans were beginning to get excited for Season 2, though, EA broke some very sour news—Season 2 had been delayed.

Instead of a new Season kicking off on January 20, it was revealed that Season 2 had been pushed back to February 17, leaving three weeks devoid of new content. Luckily for fans, EA has revealed its short-term plans to fill the gap with the Frostfire Bonus Path.

If you’re still playing Battlefield 6 and eager for new content, check out what’s in store while you wait for Season 2.

What Is The Frostfire Bonus Path In Battlefield 6?

The Frostfire Bonus Path is a new pathway of rewards coming alongside the Season 1 Battle Pass, launching on January 27, 2026.

At this moment in time, the full Bonus Path hasn’t been shared online, but some details have been made available. Rewards will range from a new Weapon Package and Soldier Skin to various XP Boosts.

Unfortunately, not all of it will come for free. EA have confirmed that some content will require the purchase of the Season 1 Battle Pass. Here are some of the upcoming Frostfire Bonus Path content broken down into free and paid rewards.

How Are Rewards Unlocked On The Frostfire Bonus Path In Battlefield 6?

Rewards on the Frostfire Bonus Path are unlocked with Bonus Path Points; these are earned by completing Weekly Challenges.

The Frostfire Bonus Path can be completed alongside the Season 1 Battle Pass, so you won’t need to choose to make progress between the prior paths and the new one. To make progress through the Bonus Path, though, you’ll need Bonus Path Points, with every ten unlocking a new reward.

Weekly Challenges are the source of these points, but the amount of points varies depending on the difficulty of the challenge. That being said, not all Weekly Challenges reward Bonus Path Points, so be sure to check the in-game Challenges menu for more detailed information.

What do you make of the new Battlefield 6 content? Does it make up for delaying Season 2? Share your thoughts in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Battlefield 6 content, check out the 2026 Roadmap, as well as Insider Gaming’s Battlefield 6 review.
